body:
Comment 4: 
Not worth triggering a new point release, but if something else does, this can go in.

Calling this a "buffer overflow" is a bit sensationalistic. It is - if the stars are
aligned correctly - reading one word past the end of the array, and as long as that read
does not fault, it ignores the data and returns the correct answer.
_Labels changed: added **release-go1.3.2**._
